cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Dorian is paralleling Florida’s east coast, then is forecast to turn north and north-northeast, tracking close to Georgia and likely making its closest approach / landfall along the South Carolina–North Carolina coast late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina or southeastern North Carolina (near Cape Lookout area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC for storm-surge flooding potential
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL to Sebastian Inlet FL for tropical-storm winds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Jupiter Inlet, Florida northward through the Carolinas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft forecast for Jupiter Inlet–Volusia/Brevard line)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–58 mph) likely with gusts higher during closest approach overnight Tue–Wed.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the Palm Beach County barrier shoreline, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 3–6 inches with localized totals above 4 inches, producing flash-flood potential in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado threat along the immediate coast late Tue through Wed.
